meanings.sent1: Loud noises can be real irritants in a quiet library.
meanings.sent2: Mosquito bites are common irritants during the summer.
meanings.sent3: The constant buzzing of the fly became an irritant during the important meeting.
meanings.sent4: Her constant complaints acted like irritants, slowly wearing down his patience.
meanings.sent5: The scratchy tag on the shirt felt like tiny irritants against his skin.

meanings.definition: A substance that causes irritation or inflammation, especially to the skin or mucous membranes.
meanings.sent1: Some plants can release irritants that cause skin rashes.
meanings.sent2: Certain chemicals in cleaning products can act as skin irritants.
meanings.sent3: The lotion, meant to soothe, turned out to be an unexpected irritant.
meanings.sent4: The harsh winter wind felt like invisible irritants against her cheeks.
meanings.sent5: The pollen in the air acted as irritants, triggering her allergies.
